definitions.definition: The number ( either a fraction or an integer ) resulting from the division of one number by another.
examples: Dividing 12 by 4 yields a quotient of 3.

definitions.definition: By analogy, the result of any process that is the inverse of multiplication as defined for any mathematical entities other than numbers.
The number of runs scored per wicket lost when batting , divided by the number of runs conceded per wicket taken when bowling — used as a league table tiebreaker in some first-class tournaments.

main_definition: ( arithmetic ) The number ( either a fraction or an integer ) resulting from the division of one number by another.
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) By analogy, the result of any process that is the inverse of multiplication as defined for any mathematical entities other than numbers.
( obsolete , rare ) A quotum or quota .

( cricket ) The number of runs scored per wicket lost when batting , divided by the number of runs conceded per wicket taken when bowling — used as a league table tiebreaker in some first-class tournaments.
